decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a mix of planeswalkers and creatures that provide value and card advantage. By playing a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Tamiyo, along with creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and generate incremental advantage over time. With access to powerful control spells like Command the Dreadhorde and Vraska, Golgari Queen, the deck can also disrupt the opponent's game plan and grind out victories through attrition.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements to manage the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Mass Manipulation, the deck aims to control the game tempo and gain advantage through card advantage and powerful spells. The inclusion of mana ramp creatures like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid helps accelerate into big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by controlling the game and deploying strong threats.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and disrupt opponent's strategies. It also includes efficient removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Lightning Strike to deal with threats, while cards like Chemister's Insight and Crackling Drake provide card advantage and threats of your own. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with counterspells, card draw, and versatile removal options, ultimately aiming to stabilize the board and take over the game with powerful spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game with powerful Simic cards like Nissa, Tamiyo, and Hydroid Krasis while generating value with cards like Jadelight Ranger and Incubation Druid. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with Llanowar Elves and Growth Spiral to cast big threats like Hydroid Krasis and take extra turns with Nexus of Fate. The inclusion of Blink of an Eye and Blast Zone also allows for removal and board control, making it difficult for opponents to mount a strong offense.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Vraska and Tamiyo, along with removal spells like Assassin's Trophy. The deck aims to gain card advantage and stabilize the board with cards like Nissa and Command the Dreadhorde. Additionally, the deck includes creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Hostage Taker to provide flexibility in dealing with threats. Overall, the deck focuses on a combination of ramp, card advantage, and controlling the board to outlast opponents and secure the win.

The deck focuses on utilizing planeswalkers and instant speed spells to control the game, allowing the player to dictate the pace of the match and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By combining powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset with efficient removal spells and counterspells, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, eventually leading to a win condition through card advantage or the ultimate ability of Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The mana base is optimized to support the color requirements of the deck's spells and strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by using aggressive creature cards like Ghitu Lavarunner, Goblin Chainwhirler, and Runaway Steam-Kin. Supporting this strategy are burn spells such as Lightning Strike and Shock, along with card draw from Light Up the Stage. Chandra, Fire Artisan provides additional damage and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and continuous damage before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play strong creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake, while utilizing spells like Chart a Course and Finale of Promise to maintain card advantage. By using cards like Goblin Electromancer to lower the cost of spells and spellslinging efficient removal such as Lava Coil and Shock, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of quick creature attacks and direct damage spells. The balance of creatures, spells, and mana sources allows for high consistency and flexibility in gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressive creatures quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a fast, efficient offense. By utilizing powerful creatures like Gruul Spellbreaker and Skarrgan Hellkite, along with mana ramp from cards like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, this deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game. Cards like Domri, Anarch of Bolas provide additional support and removal options, while burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock can help clear the way for your creatures to attack.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful cards from multiple colors in a fast-paced aggressive strategy. By including cards like Teferi, Time Raveler for control and protection, along with creatures like Lyra Dawnbringer and Shalai, Voice of Plenty for offense and defense, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. With a mix of creatures, spells, and enchantments, the deck is versatile and can adapt to different situations while putting pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting its spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Feather, the Redeemed, the deck aims to maximize value from spells like Reckless Rage and Defiant Strike to clear the way for aggressive attacks. By combining red and white creatures with green spells like Domri's Ambush, the deck aims to maintain board control while pressuring the opponent's life total. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent casting of spells and creatures to maintain pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature-based gameplay, utilizing powerful creatures like Rekindling Phoenix and Demanding Dragon to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Angrath and Sarkhan for additional threats and utility. With a mix of removal spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, as well as access to powerful lands like Blood Crypt and Stomping Ground, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and burn spells. The key strategy is to establish early board presence and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize powerful dinosaur creatures and aggressive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By ramping up with cards like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, the deck aims to play large threats like Ghalta, Primal Hunger and Regisaur Alpha ahead of schedule. Domri, Anarch of Bolas provides additional support and disruption, while spells like Lava Coil, Lightning Strike, and Shock handle opposing threats. The deck aims to beat down the opponent with a steady stream of powerful creatures and burn spells, ultimately leading to victory.

The main concept of this deck focuses on control and disruption, using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Liliana to control the board and generate card advantage. The deck also includes cards like Narset to restrict the opponent's card draw, along with removal spells like Despark and Tyrant's Scorn to deal with threats. Hero of Precinct One is used to generate additional value from casting multicolored spells, while Basilica Bell-Haunt provides a solid body and disrupts the opponent's hand. The deck also includes a small reanimation package with Command the Dreadhorde and The Elderspell for additional flexibility and power.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, aggressive white creatures. By utilizing cards like Adanto Vanguard, Benalish Marshal, and Venerated Loxodon, the goal is to establish a strong board presence early in the game. Support cards like Gideon Blackblade and Conclave Tribunal provide additional removal and protection for the creatures. The deck aims to maximize efficiency and consistency in order to maintain pressure on the opponent and secure a fast victory.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through hand disruption spells like Duress and Thought Erasure, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Bedevil and Ritual of Soot. The deck aims to generate card advantage with cards like Chemister's Insight and Discovery / Dispersal, and ultimately win the game with powerful planeswalkers like Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck utilizes a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and out-value the opponent.
